title: Magenta
summary: Magenta (/məˈdʒɛntə/) is a color that is variously defined as purplish-red,[1] reddish-purple or mauvish-crimson.[2] On color wheels of the RGB (additive) and CMY (subtractive) color models, it is located exactly midway between red and blue. It is one of the four colors of ink used in color printing by an inkjet printer, along with yellow, black, and cyan, to make all other colors.  The tone of magenta used in printing is called "printer's magenta". It is also a shade of purple.
